subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Lexical sets and QS letters
msgSnippet: ... And inventor of the lexical sets I have been talking about, by the way. ... Wells said it, I believe it, that settles it! But there is plenty of variation
messageBody:
Paige Gabhart scripsit:

> I recently inquired of John C. Wells, a linguist who lectures at
> University College in London,

And inventor of the lexical sets I have been talking about, by the way.

> According to him, this is not a known dialect from any geographical
> region, but is, apparently, a peculiarity of some people's speech, and I
> suspect a very small percentage of English speakers do this.

Wells said it, I believe it, that settles it!

But there is plenty of variation around words like "tune";
some say "toon", some "tyoon", and some "choon".

--
As we all know, civil libertarians are not John Cowan
the friskiest group around -- comes from cowan@...
forever being on the qui vive for the sound http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
of jack-booted fascism coming down the pike. --Molly Ivins
